title: Institute fellowship in the name of academic S.S. Rajagopalan: CPI(M)

content: The Budanur festival is an annual religious and cultural celebration in Karnataka centered around 13th century Hoysala-era Ananthapadmanabha temple and the Kashi Vishwanatha temple

title: Kerala‚Äôs proposed RRTS for high-speed rail travel | Explained
content: Kerala govt has approved a Regional Rapid Transit System to facilitate high-speed rail travel from Thiruvananthapuram to Kasaragod, addressing perceived Central govt neglect of previous proposals. Covering 583 km at an estimated cost of ‚Çπ1.92 lakh crore, the project aims to improve State connectivity and integrate with existing metro systems, with a phased completion target of 2036

title: TVK seeks permission for Vijay‚Äôs campaign meeting in Salem on February 13
content: According to the petition, Mr. Vijay is scheduled to address the gathering from his vehicle, with about 11,000 party cadre and 24,000 members of the public expected to participate

title: J&K LoP objects to referring Rajouri, Poonch as region; says it was ‚ÄòChandrabhaga‚Äô earlier
content: The BJP MLA alleged that some parties were acting to suit their political interests and reiterated that Jammu and Kashmir remains an undivided unit

title: Commerce Minister's press conference during session breaches House tradition, says Congress

title: Bengaluru Traffic Police crack down on bike stunts
content: The special enforcement drive was aimed at curbing reckless riding practices, and improving road safety

title: In new set of T.N. Assembly poll promises, AIADMK offers three cooking gas cylinders, hike in old-age pension
content: With the latest round of assurances, the total number of poll promises made by the AIADMK has gone up to 10

title: T.N. Assembly election: Seat-sharing committee will decide seats for Congress, says DMK leader Kanimozhi
content: Speaking to reporters after holding discussions with representatives of various organisations to elicit their views and suggestions for inclusion in the manifesto, Ms. Kanimozhi, who is heading the manifesto committee, said the panel would consider appropriate inputs for inclusion with the Chief Minister‚Äôs approval.

title: Yumnam Khemchand Singh stakes claim to form government in Manipur, set to be CM
content: Mr. Khemchand met Ajay Kumar Bhalla, the Governor of Manipur at Lok Bhavan in Imphal, and submitted a claim to form a BJP-led NDA government in the State

title: SC notice to Centre on plea challenging NBEMS's decision to reduce NEET PG cut-off percentile
content: According to the notice published by NBEMS, the NEET PG cutoff for the general category has been reduced to seven percentile from 50

title: Deepak death case: Court posts order on Shimjitha‚Äòs bail plea to February 6
content: Order was deferred in the wake of the custody application moved by police at Kunnamangalam Judicial First Class Magistrate Court

content: ‚ÄúA clear picture of the recent India-U.S. trade deal would emerge in the next two days,‚Äù Sharad Pawar told reporters in Baramati

title: Kerala consumer panel fines Bengaluru travel operator for service disruptions that cost job aspirant extra expenses
content: Ernakulam District Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission observes that a passenger transport operator is under a clear duty to provide a roadworthy vehicle and render the service with reasonable care and diligence

title: Rahul Gandhi displays former Army chief Naravane‚Äôs unpublished ‚Äòmemoir‚Äô, says will give it to PM Modi if he comes to Lok Sabha
content: The¬†LoP in Lok Sabha called Union Minister of State Ravneet Singh Bittu a ‚Äútraitor‚Äù as they engaged in an exchange of words outside the Parliament

title: Stalin to inaugurate Ranipet‚Äôs first car manufacturing plant on February 9
content: The project is estimated to cost ‚Çπ9,000 crore. The plant will be the first such facility in the country to manufacture the luxury models of JLR

title: Tamil Nadu government increases monthly remuneration of rural sanitary workers to ‚Çπ6,000
content: The last revision in the monthly remuneration of rural sanitary workers was carried out on April 1, 2023, when their salary was increased from ‚Çπ3,600 to ‚Çπ5,000.

title: Priest in Mudigere booked for rape
content: According to the complainant, she approached the priest to seek his guidance on her marriage prospects

content: He said Mr. Rajagopalan played an instrumental role in the transformation of the education system in the State

content: CM Fadnavis said if the merger talks were really in progress, then Ajit Pawar would have shared details with him

content: The Supreme Court said the CBI has already delayed looking into the allegations, and no further delay would be tolerated

title: Union budget 2026-27, Economic Survey, India-EU trade agreement and more: The week in 5 charts
content: The Union Budget for the financial year 2026-27 was presented in Parliament, the Economic Survey looking back over the last year was published, and Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar died in a helicopter crash over the last week. Here are graphics explaining these and other top stories from last week.

title: Google-parent Alphabet plans major India expansion as US tightens visa rules: Report
content: Alphabet currently employs around ‚Å†14,000 in India, out of a global workforce of roughly 190,000, according to the report

title: Kerala Assembly passes resolution against ‚Äòcontinuing neglect‚Äô of State by Centre
content: Resolution seeks Centre‚Äôs urgent attention to demands made by Kerala, including an AIIMS and approval for high-speed rail corridor that were ‚Äòignored‚Äô in Union Budget. House adopts resolution in the absence of Congress-led Opposition, which boycotted proceedings earlier over Sabarimala gold theft row

title: Watch: The Hindu Editorial | On the U.S.-India trade deal, America‚Äôs tariffs
content: The India‚ÄìU.S. trade deal has boosted markets and brought relief to export-driven sectors after steep tariff cuts were announced. However, uncertainty remains over timelines, the scope of the agreement, and claims on Russian oil imports.

title: Bioenergy development board promised land in Bengaluru, but yet to get site
content: The board was allotted two acres in Survey No. 21 of Hosahalli village in Jala hobli of Bengaluru North taluk

title: Car plunges into 100-foot gorge in Erode‚Äôs Bargur hills, two injured
content: According to the police, the accident occurred around¬†5.50 a.m.¬†between two hairpin bends when the car¬†lost control¬†and rolled down the gorge

title: Phone-tapping case: Former SIB officer Praneeth Rao demoted to Inspector rank
content: Praneeth Rao, a 2007 batch officer, was earlier suspended following his arrest in the case in 2024. With the cancellation of his accelerated promotion, he will continue in service as an Inspector.

title: A Bengali artist duo‚Äôs socio-political cartoons face bans in India, though their accounts remain active
content: Previously, many cartoonists have faced bans in India and West Bengal for showcasing social issues through their artwork

title: T.N. CM Stalin condemns suspension of eight Lok Sabha MPs
content: He demanded that the suspension of the MPs ‚Äì seven from the Congress and one from the CPI(M) ‚Äì for the rest of the Budget session, be revoked immediately

title: Kerala Assembly: Opposition boycotts proceedings amid heated disputes over Sabarimala gold theft
content: UDF members walk out during Question Hour, protesting against remarks of Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan. Opposition Leader accuses LDF government of ‚Äòdenigrating‚Äô Sonia Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi in the House to ‚Äòappease‚Äô BJP government at Centre.

title: Enforcement Directorate arrests former Rajasthan MLA in money-laundering case
content: ‚ÄúThe case is related to alleged embezzlement of MLA funds in the guise of supply of sports equipment to schools,‚Äù according to ED officials

title: Parliament Budget Session Day 6 LIVE: Mallikarjun Kharge addresses Rajya Sabha during motion of thanks
content: Lok Sabha adjourned till 5 PM as BJP counters Rahul Gandhi's claims with books on Congress Prime Ministers

title: West Bengal SIR hearing updates: 'Why only Bengal and not Assam?' Mamata Banerjee questions the hurry in conducting SIR exercise
content: The CJI-led Bench of Supreme Court issues notice to ECI on the appointment of micro-observers in West Bengal to oversee the SIR exercise.

title: India will lower tariffs on wide array of American industrial, agri goods to 0%: U.S. Trade Representative
content: The U.S. described this as a ‚Äúbig win‚Äù while noting that India will continue to control ‚Äúcertain key areas‚Äù that enjoy protection

title: ‚Çπ2,110 crore for redeveloping 61 railway stations in Karnataka
content: South Western Railway has been allocated ‚Çπ2,110 crore under ‚ÄòAmrit Station Scheme‚Äô for redevelopment of 61 railway stations in Karnataka

title: India committed to no longer purchasing Russian oil, $500 billion of investments into U.S.: White House
content: White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt said that Prime Minister Modi ‚Äúcommitted to $500 billion of investments into the United States, including for transportation, for energy and for agricultural products as well‚Äù

title: Zero excise duty on unbranded raw Tobacco welcomed by Andhra Pradesh
content: The Chief Minister said the notification brings much-needed clarity, uniformity, and transparency in tobacco taxation

title: Watch: Manipur at crossroads after BJP names new CM amid ethnic crisis
content: After nearly a year under President‚Äôs Rule, Manipur takes a key step towards restoring an elected government with BJP MLA Yumnam Khemchand Singh set to become Chief Minister. The leadership change carries major implications for peace, governance, and reconciliation in the State.

title: Traffic chaos on Mumbai-Pune Expressway after tanker overturns; passengers stuck for hours
content: The highway traffic police have appealed to motorists to avoid travelling on the expressway as far as possible until normal traffic movement is restored

title: SIT finds ‚Äòserious irregularities, deliberate misconduct‚Äô in TTD adulterated ghee case
content: Highlighting the role of the TTD Purchase Committee in the alleged episode, the probe team flags the role of Chevireddy Bhaskar Reddy, Bhumana Karunakar Reddy, and senior officials Anil Kumar Singhal, A.V. Dharma Reddy, and O. Balaji in the case

title: Train mows down elephant near Walayar in Kerala‚Äôs Palakkad
content: The Walayar stretch along the Kerala-Tamil Nadu border is considered a high-risk railway zone for wildlife, particularly elephants

title: Man killed in wild elephant attack near Peechi in Kerala‚Äôs Thrissur
content: Following the incident, angry residents blocked a Forest department vehicle, leading to brief tensions in the area

title: Watch: A Korean teacher‚Äôs 20-year journey to master Indian miniature art
content: Bridging the cultural divide between South Korea and India through the sacred Guru-Shishya parampara, art teacher Baesang Won has spent two decades visiting Bikaner to study under the renowned master Mahavir Swami.

title: Why are Meta and WhatsApp facing a judicial ultimatum in India?
content: India‚Äôs Supreme Court confronts Meta over user data sharing as Chief Justice Surya Kant tells tech giant to ‚Äòopt out‚Äô of the country if it insists on coercive data-sharing

title: Government launches survey of sanitary napkin vending machines, incinerators in schools
content: Several government schools in State face multiple challenges in ensuring menstrual hygiene, the foremost being inadequate funding and infrastructure maintenance

title: London‚Äôs Veeraswamy restaurant: from carrying curry afar to facing closure
content: London‚Äôs Veeraswamy restaurant was founded by Edward Palmer, who promoted Veerasawmy (that was the original, and colonial spelling) & Co. in 1896 chiefly to export curry powder to the U.K., which was sold under the brand name Nizam

title: Jaishankar, Rubio welcome trade deal; discuss energy, nuclear, defence, critical minerals
content: Mr. Rubio said he met with Mr. Jaishankar to ‚Äúdiscuss our bilateral cooperation on critical minerals exploration and work together to unlock new economic opportunities between our two countries.‚Äù

title: Why Governor K.K. Shah recommended dismissal of DMK government in Tamil Nadu during Emergency 50 years ago
content: Not clamping down on anti-Emergency publications too led to the dissolution of Karunanidhi-led DMK government in Tamil Nadu in 1976, when the State was brought under the President‚Äôs rule for the fist time.

title: No death sentences confirmed by Supreme Court for third consecutive year
content: Supreme Court acquits ten death row prisoners in 2025; despite ‚Äúgrowing judicial scepticism‚Äù at higher levels, Sessions Courts handed down 1,310 death sentences over the last decade; high rate of acquittals raises concerns about wrongful convictions

title: India, Bhutan to strengthen cooperation in power sector
content: ‚ÄúDuring discussions, both sides deliberated on the commercial optimisation of power output from the Punatsangchhu-II Hydroelectric Project (1020 MW),‚Äù Union Power Ministry said

content: Chief Minister¬†M.K.Stalin¬†had¬†announced in December 2024 during the silver jubilee celebrations of the¬†Tiruvalluvar¬†statue that three new ferries would be¬†procured¬†for use of tourists

content: Apart from the dynamic categories such as endurance, skidpad, autocross, acceleration, engineering design, and fuel economy, the vehicle also won first prize in sustainability and best practices category

title: Why the Church of Scotland Mission was worried about schools in Madras falling into debt
content: While notable progress was made in the area of female education, there was also concern over the lack of availability of female teachers to tutor the girls.

content: The TNSCST won under the ‚ÄòOther State Councils‚Äô category in recognition of its comprehensive, integrated, and outcome-oriented inter-disciplinary programmes, according to a release

title: Newly revamped Connemara Library offers better spaces for book lovers, researchers
content: The library now features a science park with interactive STEM activities, study area for civil services exam aspirants, and a dedicated reading section for those who bring their own books

content: ‚ÄúThe railway project was stopped after intervention of the J&K government to protect orchards and the local economy,‚Äù National Conference (NC) leader and legislator Tanvir Sadiq said

content: ‚ÄúWhat India can do is progressively expand the scope of Make in India to minimise import dependence ‚Äî though it can never be eliminated entirely,‚Äù Defence Secretary Rajesh Kumar Singh said

content: ‚ÄúThe campaign includes a four-day awareness foot march (padyatra) across the border districts of Tarn Taran, Ferozepur and Fazilka, aimed at mobilising public participation against drugs,‚Äù Punjab Governor said

content: RSGL chairperson and Principal Secretary (Mines) T. Ravikanth said that the State‚Äôs first LNG plant being established at Neemrana would benefit long-distance vehicles, mining areas, and industrial units

title: Wingtips of Air India, IndiGo planes ‚Äòmake contact‚Äô at Mumbai airport
content: An Air India spokesperson said flight AI2732 operating from Mumbai to Coimbatore was delayed after the aircraft scheduled to operate the service came into contact with another airline's aircraft while waiting on the taxiway prior to take-off

title: ED achieves 94.82% conviction rate in money-laundering cases at end of 2025
content: The Enforcement Directorate has secured conviction in 43 PMLA cases since 2020-21, wherein 104 accused have been convicted

title: Harden for Garland: Grading this NBA point guard blockbuster
content: James Harden is a Cavalier. Darius Garland is a Clipper. Kevin Pelton grades each side of the Cleveland-Los Angeles trade.

title: Harden headed to Cavs: Excited to chase 1st title
content: The Clippers sent James Harden to the Cavaliers for Darius Garland and a second-round pick, sources told ESPN, in a trade that Harden said "both sides got what they wanted."

title: Sources: LeBron expects to finish year with Lakers
content: LeBron James is expected to finish out the season with the Lakers, league sources told ESPN on Tuesday.

title: Winfield's INT of Burrow seals NFC's Pro Bowl win
content: Buccaneers safety Antoine Winfield Jr. jumped a route to intercept Bengals quarterback Joe Burrow to seal the NFC's 66-52 comeback win against the AFC in the league's third Pro Bowl flag football game Tuesday night.

title: Curry, LeBron, KD to team up at ASG; Kawhi, too
content: Stephen Curry will be joining Olympic teammates LeBron James and Kevin Durant once again, this time at the NBA All-Star Game. And the Clippers' Kawhi Leonard was added to the pool of U.S. players Tuesday shortly before the rosters were unveiled.

title: Sources: Celtics land Vucevic in trade with Bulls
content: The Celtics added some much-needed frontcourt help, acquiring Nikola Vucevic from the Bulls for Anfernee Simons and a second-round draft pick, sources told ESPN.

title: NFLPA: Players 'have no appetite' for 18th game
content: NFL Players Association leadership made it clear Tuesday that the players aren't in support of an expanded regular-season schedule.

content: Bryce James, youngest son of NBA star LeBron James, is going to redshirt his freshman season at Arizona, coach Tommy Lloyd confirmed Tuesday.

content: Abdul Carter to the Jets? Tyler Shough to the Browns? Emeka Egbuka to the 49ers? We repicked the first two rounds of last year's NFL draft.

content: Liverpool's lack of defensive depth has been an issue since last summer. Why didn't they improve it in January?

content: Arsenal will play in their first cup final in six years, aiming to put their recent lack of silverware behind them by lifting the Carabao Cup at Wembley.

content: From pregame style to fashion week, NFL fashion editor Kyle Smith helps players level up their style.

content: Mike Maccagnan and former teammates of Sam Darnold talked openly  about their unwavering faith in the QB.

content: Projected final score and box score for the Super Bowl as well as over 100 Super Bowl props arranged in five value tiers.

content: Andre Snellings and Eric Moody provide fantasy reactions as trades go down leading up to Thursday's NBA trade deadline.

content: If you deal SGA, Giannis and Michael Porter Jr., here's who you should get in return -- and who you should avoid.

title: What makes Abbey Murphy one of the most exciting players in women's hockey
content: The USA and Minnesota star's game features highlight-reel assists and goals, penalties and physical play.

title: Stevenson claims No. 1 spot in new division
content: Shakur Stevenson is the top-ranked fighter in two divisions following a dominant win over Teofimo Lopez Jr. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: Way-too-early Grand Slam predictions for the rest of 2026
content: Carlos Alcaraz and Elena Rybakina are the newly crowned Australian Open champions. Who will win the rest of the majors? We make predictions.

title: 'Traitor' vs 'sadak ka gunda': Rahul, BJP's Bittu face off outside Parliament ‚Äî Watch
content: A heated exchange occurred between Rahul Gandhi and Union Minister Ravneet Singh Bittu on Parliament steps, escalating into a political war of words. This confrontation happened amidst Opposition protests and the Lok Sabha's adjournment due to the suspension of eight MPs for disrupting proceedings.

title: Oppn, BJP MPs spar in Speaker office as Nishikant Dubey flashes 'Bofors' book in LS to target Gandhi family
content: Lok Sabha witnessed heated exchanges as opposition MPs protested BJP's Nishikant Dubey targeting the Gandhi family with book references. Following adjournment, Congress MPs met Speaker Om Birla, while Union Minister Kiren Rijiju was also present. This follows earlier disruptions over former Army chief's memoir and Rahul Gandhi's disallowed quotes.

title: ‚ÄòAs good as Bradman‚Äô: Tragic life of prodigy Archie Jackson who died aged 23
content: Almost a century ago, on February 4, 1929, 19-year-old Archie Jackson, hailed as Bradman's equal, achieved his sole Test century in his debut Ashes match for Australia. This stunning 164 was the highlight of a tragically short career. Jackson played only eight Tests before succumbing to tuberculosis at 23, leaving behind a legacy of immense promise.

title: Explained: What is Anthropic's AI tool that wiped $285 billion off software stocks in a single day
content: A swift market reaction, dubbed 'SaaSpocalypse,' saw software stocks plummet by $285 billion after Anthropic's AI assistant, Claude Cowork, launched new plugins.  The legal workflow automation plugin, in particular, triggered a selloff in legal tech and broader software sectors. Analysts now fear AI platforms are becoming direct competitors to existing software providers.

title: India-US trade deal: Kharge questions secrecy around pact; seeks clarity in Parliament
content: Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge questioned the India-US trade deal's announcement, citing a lack of parliamentary and public consultation. He contrasted it with the transparent Indo-US civil nuclear agreement. Kharge raised concerns about potential compromises, zero tariffs on US imports, and the impact on Indian farmers and Russia oil trade, demanding full disclosure.

title: Father, his 2 wives who are sisters, 5 children - all lived together before triple suicide
content: Three minor sisters, aged 12, 14, and 16, died after jumping from the ninth floor of their Ghaziabad residence. Police are investigating the incident, focusing on the girls' alleged addiction to a Korean online game and excessive mobile phone use. Family members had recently restricted their phone access, reportedly causing distress.

title: Elon Musk becomes first person on Earth worth 800bn, here's his most precious asset
content: Elon Musk has become the first person to surpass $800 billion in net worth following the merger of SpaceX and xAI, valued at $1.25 trillion. This deal boosted his fortune to $852 billion, with his SpaceX stake now his most valuable asset. This marks his second major company merger in under a year.

title: 'Kept hidden under bed box': 12-year-old employed as house help rescued from Guwahati house
content: A 12-year-old child labourer was rescued from a residence in Guwahati's Panjabari area on Sunday night. Found in poor condition with signs of abuse, the girl had been working as a domestic help for six years. Employers Amarin Akhtar Lashkar and Baharul Haque Lashkar were booked by Dispur police after initially denying the child's presence.

title: Consent to a relationship does not permit filming or online abuse, rules Delhi High Court
content: The complainant, who was a married woman residing in Delhi with her children, while her husband worked in Gujarat, came into contact with the accused due to family ties

title: 'We lose a piece of who we are': The slow fade of mud wrestling in heart of Old Delhi
content: Traditional wrestling akhadas in Old Delhi are facing a decline due to reduced public interest and the fading of local competitions. The Covid-19 pandemic exacerbated financial struggles and halted tournaments, leading to closures. Concerns over fixed bouts and betting have eroded spectator trust, impacting young wrestlers' aspirations and the sport's future.

title: Read Zomato founder Deepinder Goyal's long note to all those 'he fired' and those who resigned
content: Zomato founder Deepinder Goyal has extended an open invitation to former employees, including those who departed voluntarily and those who were asked to leave, to rejoin the company. Goyal acknowledged past shortcomings in the work environment and leadership, but emphasized the company's evolution and current opportunities within the Eternal group of companies.

title: 'Justice crying behind closed door': Mamata in SC, leads charge against SIR
content: West Bengal chief minister and TMC supremo Mamata Banerjee approached the Supreme Court to contest the Election Commission's special intensive revision exercise. She had previously met with the Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar to voice her objections, alleging humiliation during the encounter. A Supreme Court bench is set to hear the matter.

title: 'Two fell while trying to save the third': Man who saw Ghaziabad sisters jump from 9th floor at 2am
content: Three minor sisters tragically died after jumping from a ninth-floor Ghaziabad flat early Wednesday. An eyewitness reported one sister appeared to plan the jump, while the other two fell trying to stop her. Police are investigating their alleged addiction to an online gaming app and a handwritten note found at the scene.

title: Border 2' box office collection day 13: Film inches towards Rs 290 crore
content: 'Border 2' has seen a strong box office run, crossing Rs 280 crore by its second week. Despite a promising start and a Republic Day boost, the film experienced a decline post-holiday. While facing minimal competition, it's now showing signs of losing momentum ahead of new releases.

title: 'Only deletion, no inclusion': Kalyan Banerjee gives peek into Mamata's SC hearing
content: The Supreme Court heard West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's plea challenging the Election Commission's electoral roll revision, noting two key points in her petition. The court observed that timelines might need extension due to pending cases and issued notices to the EC and CEO for further hearing.

title: Seven popular car features that people rarely use: Last one is the most loved
content: Modern car features like gesture control and auto park assist often prove impractical for Indian drivers due to inconsistent performance and challenging road conditions. While impressive in showrooms, features such as powered tailgates, rear-seat screens, voice commands, wireless charging, and panoramic sunroofs frequently go unused, with owners preferring simpler, reliable alternatives for daily commutes.

title: Saudi Arabia‚Äôs oil giant Saudi Aramco raises $4 billion: Shakes global markets, has Wall Street buzzing
content: Saudi Arabia‚Äôs oil giant Saudi Aramco has successfully raised $4 billion through a bond issuance. The move highlights strong investor trust in the company's financial stability. The issuance, part of a global program, was priced in January 2026 and completed in early February 2026. Proceeds will fund capital expenditures and diversification efforts. This strengthens Aramco's financial position and boosts confidence in Saudi Arabia's economy.

title: Switch from Russia to Venezuela crude oil possible? SBI sees $3 bn savings - explained
content: India could slash its crude import bill by nearly $3 billion annually by strategically shifting from Russian oil to Venezuelan heavy crude. A discount of $10-12 per barrel on Venezuelan oil makes this switch commercially viable, despite longer shipping routes. This potential saving highlights evolving import strategies driven by market dynamics and refining capabilities.

title: Anganwadi cook saves 20 children from bee attack, gets stung repeatedly, dies
content: In a harrowing display of courage at a Neemuch anganwadi, Kanchan Bai Meghwal emerged as a true hero when she bravely shielded a group of children from an aggressive swarm of bees. Utilizing tarpaulins and mats, she managed to create a barrier, drawing the attention of the furious insects towards herself.

title: Dog on road, delay in care: Rider ‚Äòbooked‚Äô for own death in Gujarat
content: A man died after an accident caused by a stray dog, followed by alleged inadequate treatment at two hospitals. His family claims systemic apathy, as he has been booked for his own death due to negligent driving. The police are investigating the sequence of events and hospital treatment records.

title: 'I'm a very awkward guy': MS Dhoni reveals why he avoids commentary box and phone calls
content: Mahendra Singh Dhoni has largely ruled out a career in cricket commentary, citing the difficulty in balancing description with criticism and his struggle with memorizing statistics.  He prefers listening and absorbing information rather than speaking, though he humorously admits to still being awkward at phone conversations.

title: IIT-Bombay student jumps to death from hostel terrace
content: A 21-year-old IIT Bombay student, Naman Agarwal, a second-year BTech Civil Engineering student from Rajasthan, died by suicide after allegedly jumping from a hostel terrace. Campus authorities alerted police, who are investigating the circumstances. No suicide note has been found, and statements are being collected.

title: Mumbai‚ÄìPune eway in chaos: Mishap sparks 12-hour jam, traffic still paralysed
content: A dramatic incident unfolded on the Mumbai-Pune Expressway when a gas tanker flipped, bringing traffic to a standstill overnight. Cars were rerouted to the older highway as emergency crews scrambled to manage a dangerous leak of propylene gas near the Adoshi tunnel. For over 12 hours, countless drivers found themselves stranded, lacking essential services.

title: 'Is age a factor?': Dhoni backs Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli to chase 2027 World Cup dream
content: Former captain MS Dhoni supports Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli for the 2027 Cricket World Cup. He believes performance and fitness, not age, should decide their future in ODI cricket. Dhoni emphasises that experienced players offer invaluable guidance to younger teammates. He stated that if they continue to perform and remain fit, they should be considered for selection.

title: Operation Kiya: Two terrorists killed by security forces in J&K's Udhampur
content: Two Jaish-e-Muhammad terrorists were neutralized in a joint operation by the Indian Army, Jammu and Kashmir Police, and CRPF in Udhampur's Basantgarh area. The intense encounter began Tuesday afternoon following specific intelligence inputs about militant movement. Security forces established contact and a firefight ensued, leading to the successful operation.

title: ‚ÄòSafeguarded agriculture, dairy': Piyush Goyal hails India-US trade deal in Parliament
content: Union minister Piyush Goyal defended the India-US trade agreement in Lok Sabha, stating India successfully safeguarded its agriculture and dairy sectors after nearly a year of negotiations. The deal, finalized after intensive discussions, aims to promote Indian initiatives and enhance export competitiveness. US President Trump announced a tariff reduction to 18% for Indian products, a move welcomed by PM Modi.

title: Rs 1.9 lakh cr gone! Infosys, TCS crash up to 7% - how a US startup is the cause of fall
content: Shares of major IT companies, including Infosys, Wipro, HCL Tech and Persistent Systems, slid as much as 6 per cent in early trade. The negative sentiment mirrored weakness on Wall Street, where the technology-heavy benchmark Nasdaq declined 1.4 per cent, erasing nearly $300 billion in market capitalisation across the sector.

title: 'Sorry papa': Heartwrenching suicide note by Ghaziabad sisters before jumping from 9th floor
content: Three young sisters, aged 16, 14, and 12, tragically ended their lives by jumping from their ninth-floor Ghaziabad apartment. Investigators believe their alleged addiction to an online gaming app, coupled with parental restrictions and prolonged school absence since the pandemic, may have contributed to the devastating act.

title: Munawwar Rana‚Äôs daughter alleges dowry harassment, triple talaq; case filed
content: Hiba Rana, daughter of Urdu poet Munawwar Rana, has filed a police complaint. She alleges dowry harassment and physical assault by her husband, Syed Mohammad Saqib. Rana also claims her husband pronounced triple talaq. An FIR has been registered against Saqib and his father, Syed Haseeb Ahmed. The case involves multiple sections of law.

title: This IITian took break from job to sell Pani Puri, now owns popular supper club in London
content: Ankita Khante, an IITian, traded her corporate career for a passion for cooking. She started selling Pani Puri from home in London, which led to her popular supper club, The Bouzi Club.  The club offers regional Indian dishes and fosters connection through shared food memories. Ankita is now hosting a supper club in Nagpur.

title: Inside China‚Äôs gray zone activities: How Beijing is salami slicing its way to influence
content: China is employing a 'salami slicing' strategy, taking incremental steps across military, economic, and technological domains to alter realities without triggering conflict. This 'gray zone' approach, evident in the South China Sea and beyond, bypasses international law and exploits rivals' hesitation. The cumulative effect creates new facts on the ground, challenging the existing order.

title: Higher duty-free limit to gold jewellery reforms: Big relief fro UAE traverllers to India
content: India's new customs baggage rules, effective February 02, 2026, significantly benefit international travellers, especially UAE residents and Indian expats. The duty-free allowance has been raised to ‚Çπ75,000 and value caps on gold jewellery are removed, replaced by weight limits. These modernised regulations aim to simplify procedures and enhance passenger convenience.

title: Sadhguru relationship advice: Guru urges couples to share joy, not seek it; self-happiness key
content: Spiritual guru Sadhguru suggests shifting from a 'needy' to a 'nurturing' approach in relationships. He advises partners to 'share' rather than 'extract' from each other, viewing them as fellow travelers. Additionally, he emphasizes becoming the 'source of your own happiness,' as complete individuals express love from abundance, not lack, fostering enduring connections.

title: JEE Main 2026 session 1 answer key, response sheet released: Check details
content: The National Testing Agency has released the provisional answer key and recorded responses for JEE Main 2026 Session 1. Candidates can now review their answers and submit objections online until February 6, 2026, with a fee of ‚Çπ200 per challenge. This crucial step allows students to verify their performance before the final results are announced.

title: CCTV captures moment car hit Shehzad Poonawalla‚Äôs mother at petrol pump
content: In a shocking incident, political analyst Tehseen Poonawalla and BJP representative Shehzad Poonawalla have claimed that their elderly mother was intentionally struck by a vehicle in Pune, resulting in severe injuries that necessitated hip surgery. The harrowing CCTV footage reveals the moment of impact as the car accelerates away from the scene.

title: Sharad Pawar says Maharashtra CM Fadnavis 'was not involved' in NCP merger talks
content: Sharad Pawar stated that merger talks between Ajit Pawar and Jayant Patil occurred, asserting CM Fadnavis had no right to comment. He expressed happiness over Sunetra Pawar's Deputy CM appointment. Pawar also noted his unprecedented absence from Parliament on Budget Day due to a family tragedy, marking 58 years of attendance.

title: Teen gymnast dies after neck injury at school games
content: A 16-year-old gymnast from Madhya Pradesh, Ujair Ali, died after a severe neck injury sustained during the School Games Nationals in Kolkata. His family alleges negligence, claiming officials abandoned him at a government hospital. Ujair suffered a dislocation of his C4 and C5 vertebrae while attempting a double backflip.

title: 'Love game': What is the Korean task-based app the Ghaziabad sisters were addicted to?
content: Three minor sisters, aged 16, 14, and 12, died after allegedly jumping from a ninth-floor balcony in Ghaziabad. Police are investigating the role of a Korean 'love game' they were reportedly addicted to and had refused to give up. The girls had been excessively playing the task-based game since the Covid-19 period.

title: NCP uses AI-generated voice, video of Ajit Pawar to make emotional pitch in polls;
content: Ajit Pawar's party is using AI-generated audio and video clips mimicking the late leader's voice and image for ZP and panchayat samiti elections. These emotional messages aim to connect with voters by recalling his vision and trusted candidates. While intended to leverage his legacy, the tactic has sparked debate over ethical boundaries in political campaigning.

title: 'PM didn't fulfill his responsibility': Rahul displays unpublished Naravane memoir
content: Rahul Gandhi presented excerpts from former Army Chief General MM Naravane's unpublished memoir, alleging Prime Minister Modi shirked responsibility during the 2020 Ladakh clashes. Gandhi claimed the book states the PM told the Army Chief to "do whatever he wants," leaving him feeling "alone.

title: Shehzad Poonawalla's mother 'deliberately' run over by car, to undergo surgery
content: BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla alleged his mother was deliberately run over by a car in Pune, leaving her seriously injured. The accused reportedly fled the scene. Poonawalla's mother is set to undergo surgery, and he has appealed to the Pune police for the swift arrest of the perpetrator.

title: Gang assaults couple for holding hands in Tamil Nadu; attacks man‚Äôs parents
content: A five-member gang assaulted a 23-year-old man and his female friend for holding hands in Kelambakkam. The attackers also injured the man's parents when they arrived to support their son. Police have registered a case and are investigating the incident, with the victims having been threatened with further consequences.

title: Gold price prediction today: Will the rebound rally sustain? Here‚Äôs the outlook
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold and silver prices are recovering this week, but are expected to see volatility in the coming days, says Maneesh Sharma, AVP - Commodities & Currencies, Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers. He shares his outlook for gold and silver prices in the coming days:

title: Three minor sisters jump to death from 9th-floor in Ghaziabad; Korean game under scanner
content: In a devastating turn of events in Ghaziabad's Loni locality, three innocent sisters lost their lives following a tragic plummet from the ninth floor of their residential complex early Tuesday. Police officials are piecing together the timeline of this tragic fall, with early indications pointing to their involvement in an online gaming activity as a potential factor.

title: Man Stabs Mother's Lover 16 Times, Calls Police, Stands With Foot On Body
content: A man stabbed his mother's lover to death and then called the police. He stood on the victim's chest until the police arrived and took him into custody. The incident has been reported from Karnataka's Belagavi. This rivalry was 10 years in making.

title: IIT Bombay Student Jumps To Death From Hostel Terrace
content: A 21-year-old male student of IIT Bombay allegedly committed suicide by jumping from the hostel terrace in the early hours of Wednesday, police said.

title: Gujarat Toddler Swallows 'Hulk', A Complicated Procedure Follows
content: Surgeons at Ahmedabad Civil Hospital have performed a high-stakes, non-invasive procedure to save a 1.5-year-old boy who swallowed a complete plastic action figure.

title: Ghaziabad Triple Suicide Updates: "Can't Give Up Korea, Ending Our Lives": Ghaziabad Sisters' Father On Suicide Note
content: The father of three minor sisters who allegedly jumped to their deaths from a ninth-floor flat in Ghaziabad on Wednesday said he was unaware that the game they were playing involved "tasks".

title: How Japan's First Female Leader Won Over Disillusioned Young Voters
content: Three months into her tenure as Japan's first female prime minister, Sanae Takaichi is connecting with younger voters in a way her predecessors failed.

title: Iran Formally Allows Women To Ride Motorcycles
content: Women in Iran can now formally obtain a licence to ride a motorcycle, local media reported Wednesday, ending years of legal ambiguity surrounding two-wheelers.

title: More Than 250 People Killed After Separatist Attacks In Pakistan: Official
content: More than 250 people have been killed in coordinated attacks launched by separatists across Pakistan's Balochistan province since Saturday, a security official said on Wednesday.

title: "Justice Crying...": Mamata Banerjee, In Top Court, Tells Chief Justice On SIR
content: A defiant Mamata Banerjee tore into the Election Commission as the Chief Minister of West Bengal entered the Chief Justice of India (CJI)'s chamber this afternoon to argue her petition challenging the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of voter rolls.

title: Iranian Drone Shot Down By US Navy: A Look At Tehran's Aerial Arsenal
content: The US military shot down an Iranian Shahed-139 drone after it approached an aircraft carrier in the Arabian Sea, US Central Command (CENTCOM) said on Tuesday.

title: Parliament Budget Session 2026¬†Day 3 Live: India-US Trade Deal Will Benefit Farmers, Says Piyush Goyal
content: Parliament Budget Session 2026¬†Day 3 Live Updates:¬†Prime Minister Narendra Modi will address the Lok Sabha at 5 pm, as a standoff continues between the Treasury and Opposition benches.

title: Moammar Gaddafi's Son, Assassinated In Libya, Had Pet Tiger, And A PhD
content: Saif al-Islam Gaddafi owned tigers, hunted with falcons, and mingled with British high society during trips to London.

title: UP Man Kills Neighbour Couple Over Repeated "Your Sister Ran Away" Taunts
content: When taunts about his sister running away with a man became too much to handle, a man in Uttar Pradesh's Mainpuri shot dead a couple in his neighbourhood that would often pass these remarks.

title: 'Rifles, Night Vision Devices': Baloch Rebels Have US Weapons, Claims Pakistan's Khawaja Asif
content: Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif has admitted that Baloch rebels, who launched a series of attacks in Balochistan province, have advanced American weapons that even the Pakistani Army does not have.

title: Bengal Man Jumps From Bridge, Dies By Electrocution After Falling On Train
content: A man jumped from a rail overbridge in West Bengal's Ballygunge station, got entangled in overhead wires and died by electrocution.

title: Operation KIYA: 2 Jaish Terrorists Killed In Encounter In J&K's Udhampur
content: Two Jaish-e-Mohammad terrorists, including their top commander, Maavi, have been killed in an encounter by the Indian Army.

title: On Camera, Teen House Help Rescued From Bed Box, Man Was Sleeping On Top
content: In a shocking case of child abuse caught on camera, video of which is now viral on social media, a 13-year-old girl was rescued after being found locked inside a bed's storage box in Guwahati.

title: "Traitor Friend": Rahul Gandhi's Dig At BJP's Ravneet Bittu Sparks Huge Row
content: A verbal spat erupted between Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi and Union Minister Ravneet Singh Bittu at the Parliament this morning.

title: Elon Musk's X Under Investigation In France: What Are The Charges
content: French prosecutors raided Xs offices and summoned Elon Musk as they probe allegations linked to algorithms, data extraction, and Grok.

title: Opinion: Chinese AI Videos Used To Look Fake. Now They Look Like Money
content: While attention remains fixed on the race to build massive foundation models like DeepSeek's, the real contest is shifting to AI products that people will pay for and the search for a killer AI app.

title: Indian Man, Illegally In US, Gropes Woman On Flight. Then Pretends To Sleep
content: An Indian man was convicted by a court in Virginia, United States, for allegedly sexually assaulting a fellow passenger during a domestic flight. The accused, identified as 38-year-old Varun Arora, faces up to two years in prison.

title: Penny pinscher: Doberman tops Westminster field
content: a doberman pinscher named Penny won best in show at the Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show . the four-year-old dog won the most coveted show dogs prize . runner-ups went to a Chesapeake Bay retriever named Cota .

title: NBA All-Star Game uniforms and court unveiled, inspired by L.A. and new format
content: the 75th all-Star Game uniforms will be tailored to the newly formed U.S. vs. world format . a Los Angeles-style font spells out "All-Stars" across the chest of all three uniforms . the 2026 All-Star game pits two teams against one world squad .

title: Super Bowl squares: Printable grid for your Patriots-Seahawks party

title: MMA divisional rankings: Benoit Saint Denis, Mauricio Ruffy rise at lightweight
content: Saturday's UFC 325 was headlined by a meeting between the No. 1-ranked featherweight, champion  Alexander Volkanovski , and No. 2  Diego Lopes , a fight won by the champ. But it was one weight class heavier where the fight card impacted the ESPN divisional MMA rankings. Lightweight  Beno√Æt Saint Denis  knocked out  Dan Hooker  in the co-main event to move up three spots to No. 7. And in the fight right before that,  Mauricio Ruffy  scored a knockout of  Rafael Fiziev  to earn a place in the top 10. Those were the only changes in the rankings. Here are the  ESPN pound-for-pound MMA rankings  and a  list of current UFC champions  in all weight classes. Results are current; rankings as of Feb. 3. To be eligible for the rankings, a fighter must have competed over the past 12 months or must have an upcoming fight booked. Fighters who have been dropped for inactivity can be reinstated only after they compete.

title: Projecting Rounds 1-2 of the draft: Landing spots for 11 Senior Bowl standouts
